main event: A bright, circular or disc-shaped object with two bright lights, like landing lights, and a bright orange color, leaving a trail behind it, flew from northeast to southwest over Macon, Georgia.
interesting points: The object appeared to be flat on the bottom, with the lights on the upper surface.
The object accelerated and disappeared behind trees.
The description of the object with a trail indicates it could have been a meteor, according to a letter from the AEC and Georgia Power Company.
The sighting lasted for only 20 seconds.
There were no other civilian observers reported for this sighting.
sighted object: circular or disc-shaped object with two bright lights and a bright orange color
